trend: U.S. Drug Price Reform Targets Global Pharma Giants
summary: President Trump signed an executive order to reduce prescription drug prices in the U.S., warning pharmaceutical companies against price gouging and setting a 30-day deadline for proposed price reductions. His administration aims to align U.S. drug prices with those in other countries, affecting global pharma markets.
source title: GSK and AstraZeneca take hit as Trump vows to make drugs cheaper

trend: China Seeks to Attract Pharma Investment Amid Global Tensions
summary: Novartis CEO highlighted China's strategic positioning amid global instability, noting efforts to attract multinational pharmaceutical investment through business-friendly policies.
source title: Novartis CEO says China is capitalizing on global instability

trend: Global Healthcare Systems Face Financial Strain
summary: Healthcare systems are under financial pressure due to aging populations and increasing demand, prompting reforms and investment for sustainability.
source title: IMF says financial stability risks increased significantly amid trade turmoil

trend: Global Regulators Prioritize Climate Risk Assessment
summary: Banking regulators globally are prioritizing climate risk, working on frameworks to assess and disclose financial risks linked to environmental changes.
source title: Global banking regulators agree to prioritise climate risk work

trend: Central Banks Diverge Amid Tariff-Induced Economic Uncertainty
summary: Central banks are adopting divergent monetary policies in response to inflation and geopolitical tensions arising from U.S. tariffs and global trade shifts.
source title: Global markets diverge amid central bank responses

summary: Global debt rose to $324 trillion in Q1 2025, led by China, France, and Germany, while some countries like Canada and Turkey saw reductions.
source title: Global debt hits record over $324 trillion, says IIF

trend: IMF Warns of Increased Financial Stability Risks
summary: The IMF highlighted growing financial stability risks due to trade conflicts and monetary tightening, warning of systemic vulnerabilities.
source title: IMF says financial stability risks increased significantly amid trade turmoil

summary: Corporations are quietly continuing ESG initiatives while avoiding public discussions amid rising political backlash—termed 'greenhushing'.
source title: The rise of greenhushing: Embrace ESG but don’t talk about it

trend: Banking Industry Bolsters Cybersecurity Amid Threats
summary: With rising geopolitical tensions, banks globally are investing in advanced cybersecurity technologies to defend against financial system vulnerabilities and cyberattacks.
